question: You are renting a house in an English-speaking country, and the landlord has been helpful during your stay. Now your friend is interested in renting your place. Please write a letter to your landlord to inform your friend that you will be moving out. In your lettertell your landlord that you are leaving and explain whythank your landlord for being helpfulrecommend your friend as a prospective tenant.
text: I am writing this letter with mixed emotions as I decided to go to the United States of America considering my new job role as I got a promotion in my career. Therefore, I need to vacate the house by end of this month which I did not expect even in my dream.

Undoubtedly, I am going to miss your supportive talks and good judgements during critical pandemic times despite of covid rules. Hence, I would like to express my sincere gratitude from the bottom of my heart for all the help you have done and I request you to please accept my token of thanks with a small gift which cannot be replaced by your guidance.

However, I would like to introduce one of my friends who came to Vancouver a few days back and still he is in search of a beautiful house in a well-established community like ours. I would really appreciate it if you could consider his profile for your house as this will be in a vacancy position since the first week of August. He is ready to pay five months in advance, if required you are free to run a background check regardless of the rent amount.
I look forward to hearing your response with the good news about my friend's rent application. Hope it will come soon.
